classes.subject: AEM
classes.titleLong: The Business Laboratory and New Venture Management

notes.descrlong: Prerequisite: at least one business management and entrepreneurship course.

classes.description: This course is a team oriented approach to allow students to understand through a simulation what happens when a new business is launched with funding in place. During the course of the implementation they will be presented with obstacles that often occur in "real-life " situations and learn how to develop creative ways to solve and overcome those obstacles. By the end of the term, it is expected that each team will have experienced (through simulation) managing a new venture.
classes.catalogPrereqCoreq: Prerequisite: AEM 1200 or AEM 2200 or equivalent, AEM 2220 or equivalent.
catalogOutcomes: Develop a company mission and vision
Develop an appropriate budget; manage revenue and seek additional funding sources if necessary.
Interview and hire employees and consultants.
Acquire space and negotiate contracts with suppliers.
Deal with unexpected obstacles i.e. delays in material deliveries, sudden loss of key employees.
Initiate a marketing plan for the company.
